Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (like a forest or garden) and one in water (like a pond or stream).
The student can include drawings of different types of living things for each habitat, such as plants and animals that might live there.
The student can compare the types of living things found in each habitat through their drawings.
The student can show in their drawings how the patterns of diversity look different in each habitat, highlighting specific plants and animals that are unique to or common in each environment.
